page.title: 19A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN OAP
page.content: I interviewed an old lady aged 80. Living alone, she enjoys company and finds that television, especially quizzes, while away time. She also likes to garden and tend indoor house plants, as many older people do. Her groceries are delivered to her home, as she suffers from arthritis. However, she prepares her own meals. She organises all her own household tasks by the rhyme-"Wash on Monday, Iron on Tuesday", and so on. She belongs to the Methodist Fellowship and Over-60 Club. Knitting is one of her favourite pastimes. She frequently reminisces and her house is cluttered with bric-a-brac from the past. Her cat is much fondled and regarded as a valuable companion.
